page.title: 15Geology
page.content: Our town was, in a way, created one hundred million years ago in the Jurassic period of geological history when most of England was covered by sea. The sea was rich in tiny sea creatures like oolites. When England was lifted a great band of limestone was exposed. The oolitic limestone is sometimes called Bath stone and was quarried all around Bradford. The shelly limestone is used in our school wall. Our town is a mellow golden yellow colour because it is made from limestone. Limestone is quite soft and it is damaged by acid rain and car fumes. The River Avon has cut a steep sided valley through the town and there are underground streams and caverns beneath our town.
